refnamediv.refpurpose: a base class for SMT solvers that solve formulas in conjunctive normal form

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The class &class_smt_solver; is a base class for SMT solvers. SMT stands for satisfiability modulo theories. The advantage of an SMT solver over an ordinary SAT solver is that an SMT solver can interpret the functions that are part of the theories it handles. An SMT solver can thus use properties of these theories to prove or disprove the satisfiability of formulas.
The method &smt_solver_is_satisfiable; receives a formula in conjunctive normal form as parameter &par_formula; and indicates whether or not this formula is satisfiable.

refsect1.title: Preconditions
refsect1.para:
The following precondition has to be satisfied for &smt_solver_is_satisfiable;:
The argument passed as parameter &par_formula; is a list of expressions of sort &sort_bool; in internal mCRL2 format. The argument represents a formula in conjunctive normal form, where the elements of the list represent the clauses
